exceptions.tactic: apply mm_progress_DEC_0 with (n := n) (P := P) (i := i) (x := x) (k := i) (v := v) (st := s).
exceptions.exn: In environment n : nat P : list (mm_instr (pos n)) i : nat x : pos n s : nat * vec nat n v : vec nat n H1 : (i, DECₐ x i :: nil) <sc (1, P) H2 : s = (i, v) H3 : v#>x = 0 H4 : (1, P) // s ↓ The term "P" has type "list (mm_instr (pos n))" while it is expected to have type "(nat * list (mm_instr (pos n)))%type".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

n: nat
P: list (mm_instr (pos n))

v: Vector.t nat n

Goal:
(i, DECₐ x i :: nil) <sc (1, P) -> s = (i, v) -> v#>x = 0 -> ~ (1, P) // s ↓

Inductive mm_instr (X : Set) : Set := mm_inc : X -> mm_instr X | mm_dec : X -> nat -> mm_instr X Arguments mm_instr _%type_scope Arguments mm_inc [X]%type_scope Arguments mm_dec [X]%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Module Vector := Struct Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, t A n -> t A (S n) Definition t_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Type), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t. Definition t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Prop), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ##
Notation pos := Fin.t
mm_compute_DEC_0 : forall (n : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (st : nat * vec nat n), (i, DECₐ x k :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = 0 -> P // (k, v) -> > st -> P // (i, v) -> > st
mm_progress_DEC_0 : forall (n : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (st : nat * vec nat n), (i, DECₐ x k :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = 0 -> P // (k, v) -> > st -> P // (i, v) -+> st
mm_steps_DEC_0_inv : forall (n k : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p : nat) (v : vec nat n) (st : nat * vec nat n), (i, DECₐ x p :: nil) <sc P -> k <> 0 -> v#>x = 0 -> P // (i, v) -[k] -> st -> exists k' : nat, k' < k /\ P // (p, v) -[k'] -> st
mm_special_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (se : nat * vec nat n) (Q : nat * vec nat n -> Prop), Q se -> (forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : vec nat n) (j : nat) (w : vec nat n), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> P // (j, w) ->> se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v)) -> forall s : nat * vec nat n, P // s -> > se -> Q s
mm_term_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (se : nat * vec nat n) (Q : nat * vec nat n -> Prop), (out_code (fst se) P -> Q se) -> (forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : vec nat n) (j : nat) (w : vec nat n), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> P // (j, w) ~~> se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v)) -> forall s : nat * vec nat n, P // s ~~> se -> Q s
mm_compute_DEC_S : forall (n : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat) (st : nat * vec nat n), (i, DECₐ x k :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = S u -> P // (1 + i, v[u/x]) -> > st -> P // (i, v) -> > st
mm_progress_DEC_S : forall (n : nat) (P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n))) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat) (st : nat * vec nat n), (i, DECₐ x k :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = S u -> P // (1 + i, v[u/x]) -> > st -> P // (i, v) -+> st

MMA_HALTING = fun (n : nat) (P : MMA_PROBLEM n) => sss_terminates (mma_sss (n:=n)) (1, fst P) (1, snd P) : forall n : nat, MMA_PROBLEM n -> Prop Arguments MMA_HALTING {n}%nat_scope

MM_HALTING = fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in (1, P0) // (1, v) ↓ : MM_PROBLEM -> Prop
MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO = fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in (1, P0) // (1, v) ~~> (0, vec_zero) : MM_PROBLEM -> Prop

VectorSpec.append_splitat : forall (v0 : vec ?A ?n) (w : vec ?A ?m) (vw : vec ?A (?n + ?m)), VectorDef.splitat ?n vw = (v0, w) -> vw = VectorDef.append v0 w where ?A : [n : nat P : list (mm_instr (pos n)) i : nat x : pos n s : nat * vec nat n v : vec nat n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat P : list (mm_instr (pos n)) i : nat x : pos n s : nat * vec nat n v : vec nat n |- nat] ?m : [n : nat P : list (mm_instr (pos n)) i : nat x : pos n s : nat * vec nat n v : vec nat n |- nat]
mm_sss_fun : forall (n : nat) (i : mm_instr (pos n)) (s t1 t2 : mm_state n), i // s -1> t1 -> i // s -1> t2 -> t1 = t2
mm_sss_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_state n -> mm_state n -> Prop), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (v : vec nat n), P (INCₐ x) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(S (v#>x))/x])) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n), v#>x = 0 -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (k, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat), v#>x = S u -> P (DECₐ x k) (i, v) (1 + i, v[u/x])) ->...-> P m m0 m1

in_mm_sss_dec_1 : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (k : nat) (v : vec nat n) (u : nat), v#>x = S u -> DECₐ x k // (i, v) -1> (1 + i, v[u/x])

```coq
intros H1 H2 H3.
assert (~ (1, P) // s ↓) as H4.
{
  intro H4.
  apply mm_progress_DEC_0 with (n := n) (P := P) (i := i) (x := x) (k := i) (v := v) (st := s).
  auto.
  auto.

  apply mm_term_ind with (n := n) (P := P) (se := s) (Q := fun s => ~ (1, P) // s ↓).
  intros out_code_P.
  intro H5.
  contradiction.

  intro H10.
  apply mm_compute_DEC_0 with (n := n) (P := P) (i := i0) (x := x) (k := j) (v := v) (st := s).
  auto.
  auto.
  auto.
  apply H10.
  auto.
}
auto.
Qed.
